algorithms.co_training

Class CoTrainingData

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.co_training.CoTrainingData

  • public class CoTrainingData
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a collection of datasets used for one Co-Training experiment: labeled data, unlabeled data, small unlabeled pool u' and test data.

    Each dataset is represented as the array of WEKA Instances objects: each element of such array represents one view of the data (e.g. labeledData[0] - the first view of the labeled data, labeledData[1] - the second view of the labeled data)

    • Constructor Detail

      • CoTrainingData

        public CoTrainingData(weka.core.Instances[] labeledData,
              weka.core.Instances[] unlabeledData,
              weka.core.Instances[] testData)
        Creates a new instance of CoTrainingData from Instances[] arrays that represent labeled data, unlabeled data and test data. Each Instances object represents one view of the data. It is assumed that the corresponding views (e.g. 1st view of the labeled data and the 1st view of the unlabeled and test data) contain the same set of attributes
        Parameters:
        labeledData - array of Instances objects that represent different views of labeled data
        unlabeledData - array of Instances objects that represent different views of unlabeled data
        testData - array of Instances objects that represent different views of test data

      • CoTrainingData

        public CoTrainingData(CoTrainingData data)
        Copy constructor: creates a new instance of CoTrainingData from other CoTrainingData object (deep copy of the data).
        Parameters:
        data - CoTrainingData object to clone

      • CoTrainingData

        public CoTrainingData(java.lang.String path,
              int noViews,
              boolean setClass)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Loads CoTrainingData object from the given folder.

        Assumes that the folder contains 4 x <no of views> arff files (e.g. for 2 views: labeled_view0.arff, labeled_view1.arff, unlabeled_view0.arff, unlabeled_view1.arff, test_view0.arff, test_view1.arff, pool_view0.arff, pool_view1.arff). Pool files (u') are only read if they exist.

        Parameters:
        path - path to the folder that contains the files needed to populate CoTrainingData object
        noViews - number of views to read
        setClass - whether or not to set the class and id attributes
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception -
        • the ARFF file is missing
        • class attribute is missing (there is no attribute in the dataset that matches the name of the class attribute given in the data properties)
        • adding an id attribute failed

      • saveData

        public void saveData(java.lang.String path)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the current state of the CoTrainingData object to the given folder

        Data is saved as 4 x <no of views> arff files (e.g. for 2 views: labeled_view0.arff, labeled_view1.arff, unlabeled_view0.arff, unlabeled_view1.arff, test_view0.arff, test_view1.arff, pool_view0.arff, pool_view1.arff). Pool files (u') are not saved if the pool is empty

        Parameters:
        path - to the folder to which co-traning data is saved. If the folder doesn't exist it will be created
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there was an error writing the files (e.g. missing folder)

      • initPool

        public void initPool()
        Initializes the unlabeled pool u'

        Creates an empty dataset that is described with the same attributes as unlabeled instances and fills it by random sampling of unlabeled data. If pool size is set to 0 (i.e. pool u' is not used in the experiment), pool won't be initialized

      • refillPool

        public void refillPool()
        Refills the unlabeled pool u' to the size defined by the experiment settings

      • resamplePool

        public void resamplePool()
        Empties the unlabeled pool u' (all instances are moved back to unlabeled data) and resamples the pool from unlabeled data.

      • emptyPool

        public void emptyPool()
        Empties the unlabeled pool u'. Moves all instances form pool back to unlabeled data

      • labelInstance

        public void labelInstance(ClassifiedInstance instance)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Label the unlabeled instance and move it to labeled data

        The instance is searched for in pool if the pool is used in the experiment, otherwise it is searched for in unlabeled data. ClassifiedInstance object contains the label for the instance in ClassifiedInstance.getPrediction()

        Parameters:
        instance - classified instance (contains id, prediction (the label that should be assigned to the instance), confidence and actual label if available)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the instance for labeling is not found

      • labelInstances

        public void labelInstances(MostConfidentInstances mostConfidentInst)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Label all instances from the MostConfidentInstances object. These are the most confidently labeled instances selected in co-training process. The instances are labeled with assigned predictions and moved to labeled data. The instances for labeling are searched for in pool if the pool is used in the experiment, otherwise they are searched for in unlabeled data.
        Parameters:
        mostConfidentInst - The most confidently labeled instances selected during the co-training process
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if one or more instances for labeling are not found

      • testLabeled

        public ClassificationResult testLabeled(int view,
                               boolean recordPredictions)
        Tests the strength of the view. Trains a supervised model on the labeled set using only features from the selected view and evaluates the performance on the test set
        Parameters:
        view - number of view to test.
        recordPredictions - whether to record the assigned predictions in the resulting ClassificationResult object
        Returns:
        ClassificationResult object or null if testing failed.

      • testLabeledMergedViews

        public ClassificationResult testLabeledMergedViews(boolean recordPredictions)
        Tests the strength of combined classifier. Trains a supervised model on the labeled set using features from all views and evaluates the performance on the test set. The feature set for the classifier is obtained by merging features from all views. This method does not modify the CoTraningData object
        Parameters:
        recordPredictions - whether to record the assigned predictions in the resulting ClassificationResult object
        Returns:
        object ClassificationResult or null if testing failed

      • testLabeled

        public ClassificationResult testLabeled(boolean recordPredictions)
        Tests the strength of co-training style combined classifier. Trains a different supervised model for each view of the labeled set. Each supervised model is built using same instances but only features from one separate view. The instance is classified in the following way: for each class the probability that the instance belongs to this class is calculated by multiplying the probabilities output by each of the trained models; instance is than assigned the class that has the highest probability. The performance is evaluated on the test set.
        Parameters:
        recordPredictions - whether to record the assigned predictions in the resulting ClassificationResult object. This method does not modify the CoTraningData object
        Returns:
        object ClassificationResult or null if testing failed

      • noMoreDataToLabel

        public boolean noMoreDataToLabel()
        Checks whether there is more data for labeling (in the unlabeled pool or unlabeled datasets).
        Returns:
        whether there are more unlabeled instances

      • mergeViews

        public void mergeViews()
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Merge all views in this CoTrainingData object. Attributes form all views will be moved to the first view (for labeled, unlabeled, pool and test data). In the rest of the views only the label and id attribute will remain.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the merging failed

      • moveAttributes

        public void moveAttributes(int originView,
                  int destinationView,
                  java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> attIndices)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Move attributes (defined by the supplied attribute indices) from one view to another. This will affect labeled, unlabeled, pool and test data
        Parameters:
        originView - index of the view to copy from
        destinationView - index of the view to copy to
        attIndices - set of (Integer) attribute indices to move from originView to destinationView
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the error in moving the attributes occurred

      • getViewString

        public java.lang.String getViewString(int view)
        Returns attribute names for the selected views
        Parameters:
        view - number
        Returns:
        string consisting of attribute names
